newsitem.title: USA: Piercing Pagoda says accepts EPS estimates.
newsitem.headline: Piercing Pagoda says accepts EPS estimates.

text.p: Piercing Pagoda Inc Chairman Richard Penske is comfortable with estimates the firm would earn about $1.36 a share in the year to March 31, 1997.
He answered "yes" when asked by Reuters if he was comfortable with the estimate after an appearance at an Emerald Asset Management investment forum.
The firm earned $1.07 a share in the previous fiscal year.

Penske told the seminar Piercing Pagoda, an operator of gold jewelry kiosks in malls, would slow its opening of new stores to 40-50 in the 1997-1998 fiscal year from 187 in 1996- 1997 and 155 the previous year as it "digests" its acquisition in January of Gemstone Jewelry, with 100 stores.
The company's long-term plan was to have about 1,200 stores. This includes 200 "Plumb Gold" stores in malls that currently have Piercing Pagoda shops and 200 "in-line" (non- kiosk) stores.
The company will operate 690 stores by the end of March, 1997, he said.
